page.title: 02Banff and Macduff
page.content: The town of Banff is situated to the west of the mouth of the River Deveron.Originally it was built for defensive and trading purposes.The only evidence of defence today is the ruined wall of the castle while trade passes through on long distance vehicles.Banff was built around the 11th century, whereas Macduff was built only a few hundred years ago on the other side of the river.It is a more industrious town with a very busy harbour. The main historical attraction in the area is Duff House which was designed and built round about 1735 for the first Earl of Fife who owned most of the land at that time. The House is at present owned by the National Trust for Scotland and is undergoing a slow process of restoration.
